result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyrone Basey Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Fine is set at ZERO.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, BY 12-31-2016. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence; release for  inmate work assignments and The Day Reporting Center; with credit for 130 days (04-25-2015 to 09-01-2015) time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 
Under section 973.049 Court finds and prohibits contact with Kymora S. (DOB 04-15-1986). as she  was both a witness to and victim of and  in the crime in COUNT 1 and it is in the interest of the public to prohibit contact.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyrone Basey Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Order signed and filed. 
The defendants request for release on electronic monitoring is denied as it would unduly depreciate the seriousness of the offense, render the House of Correction time meaningless and frustrate the court's specifics sentencing intent. The court maintains a strong objection to release on electronic monitoring for the same reasons stated at the sentencing hearing.
Copies mailed to parties.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Carolina Stark, Branch 17, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se motion to amend the judgment of conviction to allow for electronic monitoring.

Defendant Tyrone Basey in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Tyrone Basey in custody.  Megan Marie Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1-
Court ordered defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence; release for  inmate work assignments and The Day Reporting Center; with credit for 130 days (04-25-2015 to 09-01-2015) time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 

- Under section 973.049 Court finds and prohibits contact with Kymora S. (DOB 04-15-1986). as she  was both a witness to and victim of and  in the crime in COUNT 1 and it is in the interest of the public to prohibit contact.
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, BY 12-31-2016. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Tyrone Basey in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio. Defendnat Tyrone Basey in custody, in the Court holding area, not in court. Danielle Chojnacki on behalf of Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for sentencing hearing. Attorney Lisa Procaccio will be leaving the office. Court grants motion to withdraw. Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 09-01-2015, at 8:30 am., branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court, defendant Tyrone Basey not in court, in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record. Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 08-14-2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17.   Parties notified that effective August 1, 2015, Branch 17 will be located in the Safety Building, room 310.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tyrone Basey in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Tyrone Basey in custody.  Danielle Chojnacki for Paul Hauen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State placed negotiations on the record.  The Court informed the parties that due to Branch 17 being in jury trial, sentencing would need to be adjourned.

As to Count 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Tyrone Basey in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Held off the record. Defense request a plea and sentencing date. Court orders case for adjourned Plea and Sentencing, Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tyrone Basey in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Tyrone Basey in custody.  Ronald Dague for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.    Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #14CF2126 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Scott Strong-MPD Officer.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact within 500 feet of Kymoria M.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION to include drug testing, and ELECTRONIC MONITORING. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tyrone Basey in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Tyrone Basey in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Tyrone Basey Jr
Current: 907 N. 26th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208   (Effective: 04-25-2015)
Prior: 907 N. 26th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53233
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
